item.title: Ken add a quote by Jonathan Littell
item.description: "If you ever managed to make me cry, my tears would sear your face." -- Jonathan Littell

item.title: Ken add a quote by Mikhail Lermontov
item.description: "Out of life's storm I carried only a few ideas - and not one feeling." -- Mikhail Lermontov

item.title: Ken add a quote by George Bernard shaw
item.description: "A foolâ€™s brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education." -- George Bernard shaw

item.title: Ken add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "But these young people have such an intelligent, knowledgeable surface, and then the crust suddenly breaks and you look down into the depths of confusion you didn't know existed." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Ken add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I don't want to repeat my innocence. I want the pleasure of losing it again." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Ken add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Do-gooding is like treating hemophilia - the real cure is to let hemophiliacs bleed to death...before they breed more hemophiliacs." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Ken add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "A viler evil than to murder a man, is to sell him suicide as an act of virtue." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Ken add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "I had only a little time left and I didn't want to waste it on God." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Ken add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Marriage is to me apostasy, profanation of the sanctuary of my soul, violation of my manhood, sale of my birthright, shameful surrender, ignominious capitulation, acceptance of defeat." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Ken add a quote by Derek Raymond
item.description: "I have taken a terrible beating from the truth and feel tamed, wise and desperate, as if I had taken a short route to wisdom through a mirror, and cut myself badly on it as I passed through." -- Derek Raymond

item.title: Ken add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "Do you remember that old TV series, Get Smart? Do you remember at the beginning where Maxwell Smart is walking down the secret corridor and there are all of those doors that open sideways, and upside down and gateways and stuff? I think that everyone keeps a whole bunch of doors just like this between themselves and the world. But when you're in love, all of your doors are open, and all of their doors are open. And you roller-skate down your halls together." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Ken add a quote by William Hazlitt
item.description: "Even a highwayman, in the way of trade, may blow out your brains, but if he uses foul language at the same time, I should say he was no gentleman." -- William Hazlitt

item.title: Ken add a quote by Douglas Coupland
item.description: "Life always kills you in the end, but first it prevents you from getting what you want." -- Douglas Coupland

item.title: Ken add a quote by Mary Roach
item.description: "Yes, the money could be better spent on Earth. But would it? Since when has money saved by government redlining been spent on education and cancer research? It is always squandered. Let's squander some on Mars. Let's go out and play." -- Mary Roach

item.title: Ken add a quote by Michael Herr
item.description: "How many times did someone have to run in front of a machine gun before it became an act of cowardice?" -- Michael Herr

item.title: Ken add a quote by Donald Barthelme
item.description: "Well chaps first I'd like to say a few vile things more or less at random, not only because it is expected of me but also because I enjoy it." -- Donald Barthelme

item.title: Ken add a quote by C.J. Chivers
item.description: "He gave them nicknames, including a series of people he assigned the name Stupid." -- C.J. Chivers

item.title: Ken add a quote by Donald Barthelme
item.description: "How can he be killed most easily? With the fewest stains?" -- Donald Barthelme

item.title: Ken add a quote by Adam Ross
item.description: "He closed his eyes, shook his head. If he could get her alone somewhere, somewhere completely private, he'd kill her. He would break a rock over her head and split her skull open so that he could see, just for a second, what the fuck was in her mind." -- Adam Ross

item.title: Ken add a quote by Karen Russell
item.description: "Kiwi thought back to his first weeks, when insults had been impossible for him. One time he'd called Deemer a troglodyte but his delivery had been tentative and way, way too slow, as if the insult were a fork tenderly entering a steak." -- Karen Russell

item.title: Ken add a quote by John Scalzi
item.description: "Now, you may think that this is some sort of generalized hatred that I will carry for the lot of you. Let me assure you that this is not the case. Each of you will fail, but you will fail in your own unique way, and therefore I will dislike each of you on an individual basis." -- John Scalzi

item.title: Ken add a quote by Jonathan Lethem
item.description: "I'd underestimated him. I assumed anyone who started out gut-punching you in an elevator couldn't have all that much else in his arsenal. For instance, I had no idea he could smile, let alone at such an inappropriate time." -- Jonathan Lethem

item.title: Ken add a quote by L.J. Davis
item.description: "Lowell's cubicle at the office was slightly larger than a toilet stall, but no higher, and although the door said MANAGING EDITOR, Lowell always felt that the words had been printed there in the same spirit that moves service-station operators to paint KING on the door of the men's privy" -- L.J. Davis

item.title: Ken add a quote by L.J. Davis
item.description: "You poor darling," said his wife, coming quickly to his side. She cradled his head against her breasts, a position he unaccountably loathed as much as she was fond of putting him in it, but which he tolerated now for tactical reasons. "What you need is a nice strong drink," she said." -- L.J. Davis

item.title: Ken add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "In the meantime, I would drink, rest, and ponder the meaning of this mob." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Ken add a quote by Karl Marlantes
item.description: "This nation should be less worried about putting the Vietnam syndrome behind us than restarting the World War II victory syndrome that resulted in the Vietnam syndrome in the first place." -- Karl Marlantes

item.title: Ken add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "That young man with the long, auburn hair and the impudent face - that young man was not really a poet; but surely he was a poem." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Ken add a quote by John O'Hara
item.description: "When Caroline Walker fell in love with Julian English she was a little tired of him. That was in the summer of 1926, one of the most unimportant years in the history of the United States, and the year in which Caroline Walker was sure her life had reached a pinnacle of uselessness." -- John O'Hara

item.title: Ken add a quote by Philip Gourevitch
item.description: "Genocide, after all, is an exercise in community building." -- Philip Gourevitch

item.title: Ken add a quote by Kevin Wilson
item.description: "When she called her brother, Buster said that she should climb out the window of the bathroom and run away, which was his solution to most problems." -- Kevin Wilson
